catalogue_raissonne: Delteil 102 ii/iii; Adriani 115 iv/iv; Wittrock 99 ivb/ivb
markings: Numbered in pencil, LL margin: No. 8
provenance: Ludwig Charell, New York, (until d. 1956); estate of Ludwig Charell, (1956-1957; sold, 1957, to Mia)
signed: Artist\'s monogram printed in orange ink, LL margin: HTL (inside a circle); artist\'s monogram printed within the image, UL: HTL (inside a circle)
text: Fascinated by the actress Marcelle Lender (1862-1926), Toulouse-Lautrec saw her performance in the comic opera Chilpéric more than twenty times. In choosing a bust-length pose and focusing on Lender's face as she performs a characteristic role, Toulouse-Lautrec modeled his work on Japanese Kabuki actor prints.
title: Bust of Mlle. Marcelle Lender
